issue.title: Feature Request: Make activate-on-Enter optional for Inplace

labels.name: Type: New Feature
labels.description: Issue contains a new feature or new component request

issue.body:
**I'm submitting a ...**  (check one with "x")
```
[ ] bug report => Search github for a similar issue or PR before submitting
[X] feature request => Please check if request is not on the roadmap already https://github.com/primefaces/primeng/wiki/Roadmap
[ ] support request => Please do not submit support request here, instead see http://forum.primefaces.org/viewforum.php?f=35
```

**Current behavior**
Currently, the Inplace component always activates when `Enter` is pressed when the component has focus, even if its `preventClick` property is set to `true`.

**Expected behavior**
It would be preferable to make activation on `Enter` conditional to allow full programmatic control via the `activate` method, perhaps by changing `preventClick` to `activateManually` and applying it as an execution guard in the `onKeydown` method.

**What is the motivation / use case for changing the behavior?**
While [my previous feature request](https://github.com/primefaces/primeng/issues/8931) gratefully resulted in partial programmatic control by disabling activate-on-click, the remaining activate-on-enter behavior prevents full programmatic control via the `activate()` and `deactivate()` methods, as the component will always activate on `Enter` when it has focus, overriding manually selected activation and deactivation behavior. Having the option to disable activate-on-Enter using the `activate` method allows full programmatic control and completely custom semantics.

comment.body: As testing [the PrimeNG InPlace component demo](https://www.primefaces.org/primeng/inplace) shows, this feature has not been implemented, as pressing Enter will activate the InPlace editor when the element has focus. In our project, we have resorted to overriding the `onKeydown` method of the InPlace component with an empty function in `ngAfterViewInit()` of the containing component to prevent this behavior. Per the case made in my original post, disabling this default behavior would easily allow custom mechanics for activating InPlace using its `activate()` method called from a controller method bound to any event, so I think this would be an easy-to-implement and worthwhile enhancement to add to the PrimeNG Roadmap and ask that this issue be reopened, @mertsincan.

issue.title: Feature Request: Trigger menu activation on (mousedown) || (mouseup) & menu item activation on (mouseup)

labels.name: Type: New Feature
labels.description: Issue contains a new feature or new component request

issue.body:
**I'm submitting a ...**  (check one with "x")
```
[ ] bug report => Search github for a similar issue or PR before submitting
[X] feature request => Please check if request is not on the roadmap already https://github.com/primefaces/primeng/wiki/Roadmap
[ ] support request => Please do not submit support request here, instead see http://forum.primefaces.org/viewforum.php?f=35
```

**Current behavior**
Menus using MenuModel as well as Inputs displaying a menu trigger menu activation as well as menu item selection on `(click)`.

**Desired behavior**
Change (1) menu activation to trigger on `(mousedown)` and `(mouseup)` instead of on `(click)` and (2) menu item selection / MenuModel `command` handlers to trigger on `(mouseup)` instead of on `(click)`.

**What is the motivation / use case for changing the behavior?**
This change would allow PrimeNG to support MacOS-style menu/item selection mechanics as well as its current Windows-style mechanics, making applications built on the library more user-friendly and cross-platform.

comment.body: As testing the [PrimeNG Menu demo](https://www.primefaces.org/primeng/menu) shows, this feature request has not been implemented. It seems that supporting this menu interaction user interface mechanic should be a fairly straightforward change to which events are processed for menu and item activation that would make the PrimeNG library more user-friendly by supporting MacOS-style menu/item selection mechanics in addition to its current Windows-style mechanics, so I ask that this issue be reopened, @mertsincan, to be considered for the PrimeNG roadmap.

issue.title: Paste delimited text into multiple editable Table cells [Feature Request]

labels.name: Type: New Feature
labels.description: Issue contains a new feature or new component request

issue.body:
**I'm submitting a ...**  (check one with "x")
```
[ ] bug report => Search github for a similar issue or PR before submitting
[X] feature request => Please check if request is not on the roadmap already https://github.com/primefaces/primeng/wiki/Roadmap
[ ] support request => Please do not submit support request here, instead see http://forum.primefaces.org/viewforum.php?f=35
```

**Current behavior**
Pasting (tab) delimited text into an editable cell in the `p-table` component pastes the entire string including delimiter into the single cell input.

**Expected behavior**
Pasting delimited text into a cell in the Table component would paste the text into multiple cells in an editable row, split on the delimiters.

**What is the motivation / use case for changing the behavior?**
* Data entry would be greatly speeded with the ability to paste into multiple editable cells.
* UX would match behavior of similar grids such as spreadsheets and word processor tables.

comment.body: @mertsincan — Authors cannot reopen their issues when they are closed by a repository collaborator, so I ask that you reopen this feature request issue, which I think would be an extremely useful enhancement to the Table component.

issue.title: Scrollable TabView Shows right scroll button on initialization regardless of TabPanel header overflow
issue.body:
**I'm submitting a ...**  (check one with "x")
```
[X] bug report => Search github for a similar issue or PR before submitting
[ ] feature request => Please check if request is not on the roadmap already https://github.com/primefaces/primeng/wiki/Roadmap
[ ] support request => Please do not submit support request here, instead see http://forum.primefaces.org/viewforum.php?f=35
```

**Current behavior**
When `[scrollable]=true`, the `p-tabView` component displays the right scroll button on initialization even when no TabPanel header overflows the TabView.

**Expected behavior**
The right scroll button should not appear when there is no TabView TabPanel header overflow.

**Minimal reproduction of the problem with instructions**
Stretch [the TabView page of the PrimeNG component showcase](https://www.primefaces.org/primeng/showcase/#/tabview) across multiple displays or zoom the browser page out until all 50 tabs are visible. The right scroll button will be visible even though there is no TabPanel header overflow.

**What is the motivation / use case for changing the behavior?**
The UX is inconsistent: Given that the left scroll button does not appear when there are no tabs overflowing the left margin of the TabPanel, the visibility of a scroll button provides an affordance indicating the availability of hidden scrollable content, reinforced by the TabView behavior once the scroll buttons have been pressed and then the viewport size changed to eliminate content overflow, which causes the right scroll button to disappear. The visibility of the right scroll button on TabView initialization regardless of content overflow is inconsistent with the aforedescribed UX.

**Please tell us about your environment:**

* **PrimeNG version:** 12.1.1 & 12.2.0-rc.1

* **Browser:** Chrome 93.0.4577.82 | Firefox 91.0 | Safari 14.1.2 
<!-- All browsers where this could be reproduced -->

comment.body: Reopening, as this bug still exists as demonstrated in the recently posted reproduction.

issue.title: Apollo Angular 4.0 `QueryRef.fetchMore` parameter typings remove `updateQuery` property
issue.body:
**Describe the bug**
Upgrading from `apollo-angular@3.0.1` to `apollo-angular@4.0.1` produces TS2345 error on code which passes an `updateQuery` property to  the `fetchMoreOptions` parameter of a `QueryRef.fetchMore`call.

**To Reproduce**
Previously, the `QueryRef.fetchMore` `fetchMoreOptions` parameter was typed with `FetchMoreQueryOptions` & `FetchMoreOptions` but [Apollo Angular 4 removed `FetchMoreOptions` and with it the `updateQuery` property on the parameter](https://github.com/kamilkisiela/apollo-angular/commits/6ba15daa8ac3dc81f9077be9cc1d8ea862b0ef89/packages/apollo-angular/src/query-ref.ts#diff-b47d97e5d55211e2025f70dfb7e7eb7e5d41788be0e28eb52d5df652d06199f8L103).

**Expected behavior**
The method signature should not change, since [the underlying Apollo Client `ObservableQuery.fetchMore` method still has `updateQuery` in its signature](https://github.com/apollographql/apollo-client/blob/main/src/core/ObservableQuery.ts#L391).

**Environment:**
```
├── @angular/cli@14.1.3 
├── @angular/core@14.1.3 
├── @apollo/client@3.6.8 
├── apollo-angular@4.0.1 
├── barrel-maintainer@1.5.3
├── graphql@16.5.0 
└── typescript@4.7.4 
```

**Additional context**
That pretty much sums it up.

comment.body: @jwrascoe — I'm not sure why the `incoming` argument would always be null in your case. The field policy merges we're using are either integrating skip/limit or page-based pagination results, not relay-style cursors. We're using basically a copy/paste of the [sample `merge` functions on the Apollo documentation](https://www.apollographql.com/docs/react/pagination/core-api/#improving-the-merge-function).

issue.title: Apollo Angular 4.0 `QueryRef.fetchMore` parameter typings remove `updateQuery` property
issue.body:
**Describe the bug**
Upgrading from `apollo-angular@3.0.1` to `apollo-angular@4.0.1` produces TS2345 error on code which passes an `updateQuery` property to  the `fetchMoreOptions` parameter of a `QueryRef.fetchMore`call.

**To Reproduce**
Previously, the `QueryRef.fetchMore` `fetchMoreOptions` parameter was typed with `FetchMoreQueryOptions` & `FetchMoreOptions` but [Apollo Angular 4 removed `FetchMoreOptions` and with it the `updateQuery` property on the parameter](https://github.com/kamilkisiela/apollo-angular/commits/6ba15daa8ac3dc81f9077be9cc1d8ea862b0ef89/packages/apollo-angular/src/query-ref.ts#diff-b47d97e5d55211e2025f70dfb7e7eb7e5d41788be0e28eb52d5df652d06199f8L103).

**Expected behavior**
The method signature should not change, since [the underlying Apollo Client `ObservableQuery.fetchMore` method still has `updateQuery` in its signature](https://github.com/apollographql/apollo-client/blob/main/src/core/ObservableQuery.ts#L391).

**Environment:**
```
├── @angular/cli@14.1.3 
├── @angular/core@14.1.3 
├── @apollo/client@3.6.8 
├── apollo-angular@4.0.1 
├── barrel-maintainer@1.5.3
├── graphql@16.5.0 
└── typescript@4.7.4 
```

**Additional context**
That pretty much sums it up.

comment.body: Hi, @alfaproject — Well, so far as I can see, [`updateQuery` is still available on `ObservableQuery` in Apollo Client 3.x](https://github.com/apollographql/apollo-client/blob/643c45c4ff027a12782c7ba659ece89d19952972/src/core/ObservableQuery.ts#L402) and not marked in the code as deprecated, so I think you could continue using it with Apollo Angular 4 with suitable `@ts-ignore` comments, but since I haven't seen anything to contradict the statements from the Apollo team that I linked to in my last message indicating that `updateQuery` will be removed in Apollo Client 4 and the `fetchMore` documentation has been updated to remove reference to `updateQuery` in favor of field policies, I do think that you'll eventually have to update your code to use merge functions on field policies, one for each field that needs your dynamic `updateQuery` logic. Note that field policy merge functions can be generic with respect to the data type, just as your `updateQuery` function example is.

issue.title: `ApolloQueryResult` returning partial data in `@apollo/client@3.6.9` with `nextFetchPolicy: 'cache-only'`
issue.body:
**Intended outcome:**
The behavior of `ApolloQueryResult` and `nextFetchPolicy: 'cache-only'` changed in `@apollo/client@3.6.9`. Prior to 3.6.9, the `data` returned in the `ObservableQuery.result()` Promise resolution or Apollo Angular's `QueryRef.valueChanges` Observable would conform to the shape of the underlying query and we would not see results with `partial: true`.

**Actual outcome:**
Upon updating to `@apollo/client@3.6.9`, we now are getting `data` with missing fields and `partial: true` with no changes to our codebase.

**How to reproduce the issue:**
Compare resolution of `ApolloQueryResult` between `3.6.8` and `3.6.9` when multiple queries with different shapes but the same variables are triggered.

**Versions**
  System:
    OS: macOS 12.4
  Binaries:
    Node: 14.19.1 - ~/.nvm/versions/node/v14.19.1/bin/node
    npm: 6.14.16 - ~/.nvm/versions/node/v14.19.1/bin/npm
  npmPackages:
    @apollo/client: 3.6.9 => 3.6.9 
    apollo-angular: 3.0.1 => 3.0.1 
    apollo-server-core: 3.10.0 => 3.10.0 
    apollo-server-express: 3.10.0 => 3.10.0

comment.body:
I figured out how to create a simple Apollo-Angular StackBlitz with local schema and `ApolloLink` resolvers but have thus far been able to reproduce the issue in a shareable project.

I did discover, however, that the return of partial data starting in `@apollo/client@3.6.9` does not occur without `nextFetchPolicy: 'cache-only'`, which we have set in our project to prevent refetching queries on `cache.evict()` while still getting cache updates from other requests/explicit refetches. In addition, partial data also affects normal `ObservableQuery` (Apollo Angular `QueryRef.valueChanges` Observable `ApolloQueryResult`) emissions, not just those from `ObservableQuery.result()` which I had first noted, so I updated the issue title and description to reflect these two new findings.

The problem seems to be restricted to queries on types which have field parameters on multiple array fields similar to the simplified example below. Our application has multiple queries on the same parent document, some of which return only the non-Array properties, some only the `_id` and one array property, some only the `_id` and another array property. These queries are being sent over the network and the data returned includes the correct fields but the local ObservableQueries are sometimes emitting partial results. Perhaps we have multiple queries in flight simultaneously with requests for the same Parent but different fields and the local ObservableQueries are being fulfilled from the result of a differently shaped query on the same Parent `_id`? I'm not sure why that would happen with the default `partial: false` setting but that's as close as I've been able to narrow the problematic new behavior in 3.6.9 down to so far.

```graphql
type Parent {
  _id: ID!
  name: String!
  childList1 (someParameter: String!: [Child!]
  childList2 (someParameter: String!): [Child!]
}
```

issue.title: Apollo Angular 4.0 `QueryRef.fetchMore` parameter typings remove `updateQuery` property
issue.body:
**Describe the bug**
Upgrading from `apollo-angular@3.0.1` to `apollo-angular@4.0.1` produces TS2345 error on code which passes an `updateQuery` property to  the `fetchMoreOptions` parameter of a `QueryRef.fetchMore`call.

**To Reproduce**
Previously, the `QueryRef.fetchMore` `fetchMoreOptions` parameter was typed with `FetchMoreQueryOptions` & `FetchMoreOptions` but [Apollo Angular 4 removed `FetchMoreOptions` and with it the `updateQuery` property on the parameter](https://github.com/kamilkisiela/apollo-angular/commits/6ba15daa8ac3dc81f9077be9cc1d8ea862b0ef89/packages/apollo-angular/src/query-ref.ts#diff-b47d97e5d55211e2025f70dfb7e7eb7e5d41788be0e28eb52d5df652d06199f8L103).

**Expected behavior**
The method signature should not change, since [the underlying Apollo Client `ObservableQuery.fetchMore` method still has `updateQuery` in its signature](https://github.com/apollographql/apollo-client/blob/main/src/core/ObservableQuery.ts#L391).

**Environment:**
```
├── @angular/cli@14.1.3 
├── @angular/core@14.1.3 
├── @apollo/client@3.6.8 
├── apollo-angular@4.0.1 
├── barrel-maintainer@1.5.3
├── graphql@16.5.0 
└── typescript@4.7.4 
```

**Additional context**
That pretty much sums it up.

comment.body: Finding that this typing issue still exists in release 4.1.0, I investigated further and found that while `updateQuery` is still supported Apollo Client 3, [it is deprecated](https://github.com/apollographql/apollo-client/pull/6464) and [will be removed in the next major version of Apollo Client](https://github.com/apollographql/apollo-client/blob/main/CHANGELOG.md#apollo-client-300), so while its removal in Apollo Angular 4 may be somewhat premature, it is inevitable. I refactored our use of `updateQuery` (merging paginated results) to use the Apollo Client recommended solution of adding [a field policy with a merge function](https://www.apollographql.com/docs/react/pagination/core-api/#merging-paginated-results).

issue.title: Incompatible typing with `graphql^16.0.0` produces `error TS2430: Interface 'SubscriptionResult<TData>' incorrectly extends interface 'ExecutionResult<ObjMap<unknown>, ObjMap<unknown>>'.`

labels.name: stage/0-issue-prerequisites
labels.description: Needs more information before we can start working on it

issue.body:
**Describe the bug**
When attempting to update an `apollo-angular` project to `graphql^16.0.0` project transpilation produces `error TS2430: Interface 'SubscriptionResult<TData>' incorrectly extends interface 'ExecutionResult<ObjMap<unknown>, ObjMap<unknown>>'.`:

```
Error: node_modules/apollo-angular/types.d.ts:30:18 - error TS2430: Interface 'SubscriptionResult<TData>' incorrectly extends interface 'ExecutionResult<ObjMap<unknown>, ObjMap<unknown>>'.
  Types of property 'data' are incompatible.
    Type 'TData' is not assignable to type 'ObjMap<unknown>'.

30 export interface SubscriptionResult<TData> extends ExecutionResult {
                    ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
```

**To Reproduce**
Run `tsc` on project depending on `apollo-angular@2.6.0` & `graphql^16.0.0` with a `tsconfig.json` observing the default` skipLibCheck: false`.

**Expected behavior**
Updating to `graphql^16.0.0` should work without error.

**Environment:**
```
├── @angular/cli@13.0.3 
├── @angular/core@13.0.2 
├── @apollo/client@3.5.3 
├── @types/graphql@14.5.0
├── apollo-angular@2.6.0 
├── graphql@16.0.1 
└── typescript@4.4.4 
```

**Additional context**
The bug description has been updated to correct the original incorrect attribution of this typing error to upgrading `@apollo/client^3.5.0` when in fact the upgrade causing the problem was from `graphql@15.7.2` to `graphql@16.0.1`.

comment.body: Yes, this incompatibility with the GraphQL 16 types was resolved with the release of Apollo Angular 3. There are new typing issues with Apollo Angular 4 and Apollo Client, per #1810 & #1818, but they are different from this issue.

issue.title: Cannot use subscriptions with the newest version of apollo-angular
issue.body:
As it is said in the title, I cannot use subscriptions with the newest version of apollo-angular. I saw a subscriptions-transport-ws is not used anymore. What to do with that?
Thanks for reply.

comment.body: I believe this is a duplicate of #1801. The solution is to use `graphql-ws` instead of `subscriptions-transport-ws`.

issue.title: Feature Request: Make activate-on-Enter optional for Inplace

labels.name: Type: New Feature
labels.description: Issue contains a new feature or new component request

issue.body:
**I'm submitting a ...**  (check one with "x")
```
[ ] bug report => Search github for a similar issue or PR before submitting
[X] feature request => Please check if request is not on the roadmap already https://github.com/primefaces/primeng/wiki/Roadmap
[ ] support request => Please do not submit support request here, instead see http://forum.primefaces.org/viewforum.php?f=35
```

**Current behavior**
Currently, the Inplace component always activates when `Enter` is pressed when the component has focus, even if its `preventClick` property is set to `true`.

**Expected behavior**
It would be preferable to make activation on `Enter` conditional to allow full programmatic control via the `activate` method, perhaps by changing `preventClick` to `activateManually` and applying it as an execution guard in the `onKeydown` method.

**What is the motivation / use case for changing the behavior?**
While [my previous feature request](https://github.com/primefaces/primeng/issues/8931) gratefully resulted in partial programmatic control by disabling activate-on-click, the remaining activate-on-enter behavior prevents full programmatic control via the `activate()` and `deactivate()` methods, as the component will always activate on `Enter` when it has focus, overriding manually selected activation and deactivation behavior. Having the option to disable activate-on-Enter using the `activate` method allows full programmatic control and completely custom semantics.

comment.body: As testing [the PrimeNG InPlace component demo](https://www.primefaces.org/primeng/inplace) shows, this feature has not been implemented, as pressing Enter will activate the InPlace editor when the element has focus. In our project, we have resorted to overriding the `onKeydown` method of the InPlace component with an empty function in `ngAfterViewInit()` of the containing component to prevent this behavior. Per the case made in my original post, disabling this default behavior would easily allow custom mechanics for activating InPlace using its `activate()` method called from a controller method bound to any event, so I think this would be an easy-to-implement and worthwhile enhancement to add to the PrimeNG Roadmap and ask that this issue be reopened, @mertsincan.

issue.title: Feature Request: Trigger menu activation on (mousedown) || (mouseup) & menu item activation on (mouseup)

labels.name: Type: New Feature
labels.description: Issue contains a new feature or new component request

issue.body:
**I'm submitting a ...**  (check one with "x")
```
[ ] bug report => Search github for a similar issue or PR before submitting
[X] feature request => Please check if request is not on the roadmap already https://github.com/primefaces/primeng/wiki/Roadmap
[ ] support request => Please do not submit support request here, instead see http://forum.primefaces.org/viewforum.php?f=35
```

**Current behavior**
Menus using MenuModel as well as Inputs displaying a menu trigger menu activation as well as menu item selection on `(click)`.

**Desired behavior**
Change (1) menu activation to trigger on `(mousedown)` and `(mouseup)` instead of on `(click)` and (2) menu item selection / MenuModel `command` handlers to trigger on `(mouseup)` instead of on `(click)`.

**What is the motivation / use case for changing the behavior?**
This change would allow PrimeNG to support MacOS-style menu/item selection mechanics as well as its current Windows-style mechanics, making applications built on the library more user-friendly and cross-platform.

comment.body: As testing the [PrimeNG Menu demo](https://www.primefaces.org/primeng/menu) shows, this feature request has not been implemented. It seems that supporting this menu interaction user interface mechanic should be a fairly straightforward change to which events are processed for menu and item activation that would make the PrimeNG library more user-friendly by supporting MacOS-style menu/item selection mechanics in addition to its current Windows-style mechanics, so I ask that this issue be reopened, @mertsincan, to be considered for the PrimeNG roadmap.

issue.title: Scrollable TabView Shows right scroll button on initialization regardless of TabPanel header overflow
issue.body:
**I'm submitting a ...**  (check one with "x")
```
[X] bug report => Search github for a similar issue or PR before submitting
[ ] feature request => Please check if request is not on the roadmap already https://github.com/primefaces/primeng/wiki/Roadmap
[ ] support request => Please do not submit support request here, instead see http://forum.primefaces.org/viewforum.php?f=35
```

**Current behavior**
When `[scrollable]=true`, the `p-tabView` component displays the right scroll button on initialization even when no TabPanel header overflows the TabView.

**Expected behavior**
The right scroll button should not appear when there is no TabView TabPanel header overflow.

**Minimal reproduction of the problem with instructions**
Stretch [the TabView page of the PrimeNG component showcase](https://www.primefaces.org/primeng/showcase/#/tabview) across multiple displays or zoom the browser page out until all 50 tabs are visible. The right scroll button will be visible even though there is no TabPanel header overflow.

**What is the motivation / use case for changing the behavior?**
The UX is inconsistent: Given that the left scroll button does not appear when there are no tabs overflowing the left margin of the TabPanel, the visibility of a scroll button provides an affordance indicating the availability of hidden scrollable content, reinforced by the TabView behavior once the scroll buttons have been pressed and then the viewport size changed to eliminate content overflow, which causes the right scroll button to disappear. The visibility of the right scroll button on TabView initialization regardless of content overflow is inconsistent with the aforedescribed UX.

**Please tell us about your environment:**

* **PrimeNG version:** 12.1.1 & 12.2.0-rc.1

* **Browser:** Chrome 93.0.4577.82 | Firefox 91.0 | Safari 14.1.2 
<!-- All browsers where this could be reproduced -->

comment.body: Reopening, as this bug still exists as demonstrated in the recently posted reproduction.

issue.title: Apollo Angular 4.0 `QueryRef.fetchMore` parameter typings remove `updateQuery` property
issue.body:
**Describe the bug**
Upgrading from `apollo-angular@3.0.1` to `apollo-angular@4.0.1` produces TS2345 error on code which passes an `updateQuery` property to  the `fetchMoreOptions` parameter of a `QueryRef.fetchMore`call.

**To Reproduce**
Previously, the `QueryRef.fetchMore` `fetchMoreOptions` parameter was typed with `FetchMoreQueryOptions` & `FetchMoreOptions` but [Apollo Angular 4 removed `FetchMoreOptions` and with it the `updateQuery` property on the parameter](https://github.com/kamilkisiela/apollo-angular/commits/6ba15daa8ac3dc81f9077be9cc1d8ea862b0ef89/packages/apollo-angular/src/query-ref.ts#diff-b47d97e5d55211e2025f70dfb7e7eb7e5d41788be0e28eb52d5df652d06199f8L103).

**Expected behavior**
The method signature should not change, since [the underlying Apollo Client `ObservableQuery.fetchMore` method still has `updateQuery` in its signature](https://github.com/apollographql/apollo-client/blob/main/src/core/ObservableQuery.ts#L391).

**Environment:**
```
├── @angular/cli@14.1.3 
├── @angular/core@14.1.3 
├── @apollo/client@3.6.8 
├── apollo-angular@4.0.1 
├── barrel-maintainer@1.5.3
├── graphql@16.5.0 
└── typescript@4.7.4 
```

**Additional context**
That pretty much sums it up.

comment.body: @jwrascoe — I'm not sure why the `incoming` argument would always be null in your case. The field policy merges we're using are either integrating skip/limit or page-based pagination results, not relay-style cursors. We're using basically a copy/paste of the [sample `merge` functions on the Apollo documentation](https://www.apollographql.com/docs/react/pagination/core-api/#improving-the-merge-function).

issue.title: Apollo Angular 4.0 `QueryRef.fetchMore` parameter typings remove `updateQuery` property
issue.body:
**Describe the bug**
Upgrading from `apollo-angular@3.0.1` to `apollo-angular@4.0.1` produces TS2345 error on code which passes an `updateQuery` property to  the `fetchMoreOptions` parameter of a `QueryRef.fetchMore`call.

**To Reproduce**
Previously, the `QueryRef.fetchMore` `fetchMoreOptions` parameter was typed with `FetchMoreQueryOptions` & `FetchMoreOptions` but [Apollo Angular 4 removed `FetchMoreOptions` and with it the `updateQuery` property on the parameter](https://github.com/kamilkisiela/apollo-angular/commits/6ba15daa8ac3dc81f9077be9cc1d8ea862b0ef89/packages/apollo-angular/src/query-ref.ts#diff-b47d97e5d55211e2025f70dfb7e7eb7e5d41788be0e28eb52d5df652d06199f8L103).

**Expected behavior**
The method signature should not change, since [the underlying Apollo Client `ObservableQuery.fetchMore` method still has `updateQuery` in its signature](https://github.com/apollographql/apollo-client/blob/main/src/core/ObservableQuery.ts#L391).

**Environment:**
```
├── @angular/cli@14.1.3 
├── @angular/core@14.1.3 
├── @apollo/client@3.6.8 
├── apollo-angular@4.0.1 
├── barrel-maintainer@1.5.3
├── graphql@16.5.0 
└── typescript@4.7.4 
```

**Additional context**
That pretty much sums it up.

comment.body: Hi, @alfaproject — Well, so far as I can see, [`updateQuery` is still available on `ObservableQuery` in Apollo Client 3.x](https://github.com/apollographql/apollo-client/blob/643c45c4ff027a12782c7ba659ece89d19952972/src/core/ObservableQuery.ts#L402) and not marked in the code as deprecated, so I think you could continue using it with Apollo Angular 4 with suitable `@ts-ignore` comments, but since I haven't seen anything to contradict the statements from the Apollo team that I linked to in my last message indicating that `updateQuery` will be removed in Apollo Client 4 and the `fetchMore` documentation has been updated to remove reference to `updateQuery` in favor of field policies, I do think that you'll eventually have to update your code to use merge functions on field policies, one for each field that needs your dynamic `updateQuery` logic. Note that field policy merge functions can be generic with respect to the data type, just as your `updateQuery` function example is.

issue.title: `ApolloQueryResult` returning partial data in `@apollo/client@3.6.9` with `nextFetchPolicy: 'cache-only'`
issue.body:
**Intended outcome:**
The behavior of `ApolloQueryResult` and `nextFetchPolicy: 'cache-only'` changed in `@apollo/client@3.6.9`. Prior to 3.6.9, the `data` returned in the `ObservableQuery.result()` Promise resolution or Apollo Angular's `QueryRef.valueChanges` Observable would conform to the shape of the underlying query and we would not see results with `partial: true`.

**Actual outcome:**
Upon updating to `@apollo/client@3.6.9`, we now are getting `data` with missing fields and `partial: true` with no changes to our codebase.

**How to reproduce the issue:**
Compare resolution of `ApolloQueryResult` between `3.6.8` and `3.6.9` when multiple queries with different shapes but the same variables are triggered.

**Versions**
  System:
    OS: macOS 12.4
  Binaries:
    Node: 14.19.1 - ~/.nvm/versions/node/v14.19.1/bin/node
    npm: 6.14.16 - ~/.nvm/versions/node/v14.19.1/bin/npm
  npmPackages:
    @apollo/client: 3.6.9 => 3.6.9 
    apollo-angular: 3.0.1 => 3.0.1 
    apollo-server-core: 3.10.0 => 3.10.0 
    apollo-server-express: 3.10.0 => 3.10.0

comment.body:
I figured out how to create a simple Apollo-Angular StackBlitz with local schema and `ApolloLink` resolvers but have thus far been able to reproduce the issue in a shareable project.

I did discover, however, that the return of partial data starting in `@apollo/client@3.6.9` does not occur without `nextFetchPolicy: 'cache-only'`, which we have set in our project to prevent refetching queries on `cache.evict()` while still getting cache updates from other requests/explicit refetches. In addition, partial data also affects normal `ObservableQuery` (Apollo Angular `QueryRef.valueChanges` Observable `ApolloQueryResult`) emissions, not just those from `ObservableQuery.result()` which I had first noted, so I updated the issue title and description to reflect these two new findings.

The problem seems to be restricted to queries on types which have field parameters on multiple array fields similar to the simplified example below. Our application has multiple queries on the same parent document, some of which return only the non-Array properties, some only the `_id` and one array property, some only the `_id` and another array property. These queries are being sent over the network and the data returned includes the correct fields but the local ObservableQueries are sometimes emitting partial results. Perhaps we have multiple queries in flight simultaneously with requests for the same Parent but different fields and the local ObservableQueries are being fulfilled from the result of a differently shaped query on the same Parent `_id`? I'm not sure why that would happen with the default `partial: false` setting but that's as close as I've been able to narrow the problematic new behavior in 3.6.9 down to so far.

```graphql
type Parent {
  _id: ID!
  name: String!
  childList1 (someParameter: String!: [Child!]
  childList2 (someParameter: String!): [Child!]
}
```

issue.body:
**Describe the bug**
Upgrading from `apollo-angular@3.0.1` to `apollo-angular@4.0.1` produces TS2345 error on code which passes an `updateQuery` property to  the `fetchMoreOptions` parameter of a `QueryRef.fetchMore`call.

**To Reproduce**
Previously, the `QueryRef.fetchMore` `fetchMoreOptions` parameter was typed with `FetchMoreQueryOptions` & `FetchMoreOptions` but [Apollo Angular 4 removed `FetchMoreOptions` and with it the `updateQuery` property on the parameter](https://github.com/kamilkisiela/apollo-angular/commits/6ba15daa8ac3dc81f9077be9cc1d8ea862b0ef89/packages/apollo-angular/src/query-ref.ts#diff-b47d97e5d55211e2025f70dfb7e7eb7e5d41788be0e28eb52d5df652d06199f8L103).

comment.body: Finding that this typing issue still exists in release 4.1.0, I investigated further and found that while `updateQuery` is still supported Apollo Client 3, [it is deprecated](https://github.com/apollographql/apollo-client/pull/6464) and [will be removed in the next major version of Apollo Client](https://github.com/apollographql/apollo-client/blob/main/CHANGELOG.md#apollo-client-300), so while its removal in Apollo Angular 4 may be somewhat premature, it is inevitable. I refactored our use of `updateQuery` (merging paginated results) to use the Apollo Client recommended solution of adding [a field policy with a merge function](https://www.apollographql.com/docs/react/pagination/core-api/#merging-paginated-results).

issue.title: Incompatible typing with `graphql^16.0.0` produces `error TS2430: Interface 'SubscriptionResult<TData>' incorrectly extends interface 'ExecutionResult<ObjMap<unknown>, ObjMap<unknown>>'.`

labels.name: stage/0-issue-prerequisites
labels.description: Needs more information before we can start working on it

issue.body:
**Describe the bug**
When attempting to update an `apollo-angular` project to `graphql^16.0.0` project transpilation produces `error TS2430: Interface 'SubscriptionResult<TData>' incorrectly extends interface 'ExecutionResult<ObjMap<unknown>, ObjMap<unknown>>'.`:

```
Error: node_modules/apollo-angular/types.d.ts:30:18 - error TS2430: Interface 'SubscriptionResult<TData>' incorrectly extends interface 'ExecutionResult<ObjMap<unknown>, ObjMap<unknown>>'.
  Types of property 'data' are incompatible.
    Type 'TData' is not assignable to type 'ObjMap<unknown>'.

30 export interface SubscriptionResult<TData> extends ExecutionResult {
                    ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
```

**To Reproduce**
Run `tsc` on project depending on `apollo-angular@2.6.0` & `graphql^16.0.0` with a `tsconfig.json` observing the default` skipLibCheck: false`.

**Expected behavior**
Updating to `graphql^16.0.0` should work without error.

**Environment:**
```
├── @angular/cli@13.0.3 
├── @angular/core@13.0.2 
├── @apollo/client@3.5.3 
├── @types/graphql@14.5.0
├── apollo-angular@2.6.0 
├── graphql@16.0.1 
└── typescript@4.4.4 
```

**Additional context**
The bug description has been updated to correct the original incorrect attribution of this typing error to upgrading `@apollo/client^3.5.0` when in fact the upgrade causing the problem was from `graphql@15.7.2` to `graphql@16.0.1`.

comment.body: Yes, this incompatibility with the GraphQL 16 types was resolved with the release of Apollo Angular 3. There are new typing issues with Apollo Angular 4 and Apollo Client, per #1810 & #1818, but they are different from this issue.

issue.title: Feature Request: Make activate-on-Enter optional for Inplace

labels.name: Type: New Feature
labels.description: Issue contains a new feature or new component request

issue.body:
**I'm submitting a ...**  (check one with "x")
```
[ ] bug report => Search github for a similar issue or PR before submitting
[X] feature request => Please check if request is not on the roadmap already https://github.com/primefaces/primeng/wiki/Roadmap
[ ] support request => Please do not submit support request here, instead see http://forum.primefaces.org/viewforum.php?f=35
```

**Current behavior**
Currently, the Inplace component always activates when `Enter` is pressed when the component has focus, even if its `preventClick` property is set to `true`.

**Expected behavior**
It would be preferable to make activation on `Enter` conditional to allow full programmatic control via the `activate` method, perhaps by changing `preventClick` to `activateManually` and applying it as an execution guard in the `onKeydown` method.

**What is the motivation / use case for changing the behavior?**
While [my previous feature request](https://github.com/primefaces/primeng/issues/8931) gratefully resulted in partial programmatic control by disabling activate-on-click, the remaining activate-on-enter behavior prevents full programmatic control via the `activate()` and `deactivate()` methods, as the component will always activate on `Enter` when it has focus, overriding manually selected activation and deactivation behavior. Having the option to disable activate-on-Enter using the `activate` method allows full programmatic control and completely custom semantics.

comment.body: As testing [the PrimeNG InPlace component demo](https://www.primefaces.org/primeng/inplace) shows, this feature has not been implemented, as pressing Enter will activate the InPlace editor when the element has focus. In our project, we have resorted to overriding the `onKeydown` method of the InPlace component with an empty function in `ngAfterViewInit()` of the containing component to prevent this behavior. Per the case made in my original post, disabling this default behavior would easily allow custom mechanics for activating InPlace using its `activate()` method called from a controller method bound to any event, so I think this would be an easy-to-implement and worthwhile enhancement to add to the PrimeNG Roadmap and ask that this issue be reopened, @mertsincan.

issue.title: Feature Request: Trigger menu activation on (mousedown) || (mouseup) & menu item activation on (mouseup)

labels.name: Type: New Feature
labels.description: Issue contains a new feature or new component request

issue.body:
**I'm submitting a ...**  (check one with "x")
```
[ ] bug report => Search github for a similar issue or PR before submitting
[X] feature request => Please check if request is not on the roadmap already https://github.com/primefaces/primeng/wiki/Roadmap
[ ] support request => Please do not submit support request here, instead see http://forum.primefaces.org/viewforum.php?f=35
```

**Current behavior**
Menus using MenuModel as well as Inputs displaying a menu trigger menu activation as well as menu item selection on `(click)`.

**Desired behavior**
Change (1) menu activation to trigger on `(mousedown)` and `(mouseup)` instead of on `(click)` and (2) menu item selection / MenuModel `command` handlers to trigger on `(mouseup)` instead of on `(click)`.

**What is the motivation / use case for changing the behavior?**
This change would allow PrimeNG to support MacOS-style menu/item selection mechanics as well as its current Windows-style mechanics, making applications built on the library more user-friendly and cross-platform.

comment.body: As testing the [PrimeNG Menu demo](https://www.primefaces.org/primeng/menu) shows, this feature request has not been implemented. It seems that supporting this menu interaction user interface mechanic should be a fairly straightforward change to which events are processed for menu and item activation that would make the PrimeNG library more user-friendly by supporting MacOS-style menu/item selection mechanics in addition to its current Windows-style mechanics, so I ask that this issue be reopened, @mertsincan, to be considered for the PrimeNG roadmap.

issue.title: Scrollable TabView Shows right scroll button on initialization regardless of TabPanel header overflow
issue.body:
**I'm submitting a ...**  (check one with "x")
```
[X] bug report => Search github for a similar issue or PR before submitting
[ ] feature request => Please check if request is not on the roadmap already https://github.com/primefaces/primeng/wiki/Roadmap
[ ] support request => Please do not submit support request here, instead see http://forum.primefaces.org/viewforum.php?f=35
```

**Current behavior**
When `[scrollable]=true`, the `p-tabView` component displays the right scroll button on initialization even when no TabPanel header overflows the TabView.

**Expected behavior**
The right scroll button should not appear when there is no TabView TabPanel header overflow.

**Minimal reproduction of the problem with instructions**
Stretch [the TabView page of the PrimeNG component showcase](https://www.primefaces.org/primeng/showcase/#/tabview) across multiple displays or zoom the browser page out until all 50 tabs are visible. The right scroll button will be visible even though there is no TabPanel header overflow.

**What is the motivation / use case for changing the behavior?**
The UX is inconsistent: Given that the left scroll button does not appear when there are no tabs overflowing the left margin of the TabPanel, the visibility of a scroll button provides an affordance indicating the availability of hidden scrollable content, reinforced by the TabView behavior once the scroll buttons have been pressed and then the viewport size changed to eliminate content overflow, which causes the right scroll button to disappear. The visibility of the right scroll button on TabView initialization regardless of content overflow is inconsistent with the aforedescribed UX.

**Please tell us about your environment:**

* **PrimeNG version:** 12.1.1 & 12.2.0-rc.1

* **Browser:** Chrome 93.0.4577.82 | Firefox 91.0 | Safari 14.1.2 
<!-- All browsers where this could be reproduced -->

comment.body: Reopening, as this bug still exists as demonstrated in the recently posted reproduction.

issue.title: Apollo Angular 4.0 `QueryRef.fetchMore` parameter typings remove `updateQuery` property
issue.body:
**Describe the bug**
Upgrading from `apollo-angular@3.0.1` to `apollo-angular@4.0.1` produces TS2345 error on code which passes an `updateQuery` property to  the `fetchMoreOptions` parameter of a `QueryRef.fetchMore`call.

**To Reproduce**
Previously, the `QueryRef.fetchMore` `fetchMoreOptions` parameter was typed with `FetchMoreQueryOptions` & `FetchMoreOptions` but [Apollo Angular 4 removed `FetchMoreOptions` and with it the `updateQuery` property on the parameter](https://github.com/kamilkisiela/apollo-angular/commits/6ba15daa8ac3dc81f9077be9cc1d8ea862b0ef89/packages/apollo-angular/src/query-ref.ts#diff-b47d97e5d55211e2025f70dfb7e7eb7e5d41788be0e28eb52d5df652d06199f8L103).

**Expected behavior**
The method signature should not change, since [the underlying Apollo Client `ObservableQuery.fetchMore` method still has `updateQuery` in its signature](https://github.com/apollographql/apollo-client/blob/main/src/core/ObservableQuery.ts#L391).

**Environment:**
```
├── @angular/cli@14.1.3 
├── @angular/core@14.1.3 
├── @apollo/client@3.6.8 
├── apollo-angular@4.0.1 
├── barrel-maintainer@1.5.3
├── graphql@16.5.0 
└── typescript@4.7.4 
```

**Additional context**
That pretty much sums it up.

comment.body: @jwrascoe — I'm not sure why the `incoming` argument would always be null in your case. The field policy merges we're using are either integrating skip/limit or page-based pagination results, not relay-style cursors. We're using basically a copy/paste of the [sample `merge` functions on the Apollo documentation](https://www.apollographql.com/docs/react/pagination/core-api/#improving-the-merge-function).

issue.title: Apollo Angular 4.0 `QueryRef.fetchMore` parameter typings remove `updateQuery` property
issue.body:
**Describe the bug**
Upgrading from `apollo-angular@3.0.1` to `apollo-angular@4.0.1` produces TS2345 error on code which passes an `updateQuery` property to  the `fetchMoreOptions` parameter of a `QueryRef.fetchMore`call.

**To Reproduce**
Previously, the `QueryRef.fetchMore` `fetchMoreOptions` parameter was typed with `FetchMoreQueryOptions` & `FetchMoreOptions` but [Apollo Angular 4 removed `FetchMoreOptions` and with it the `updateQuery` property on the parameter](https://github.com/kamilkisiela/apollo-angular/commits/6ba15daa8ac3dc81f9077be9cc1d8ea862b0ef89/packages/apollo-angular/src/query-ref.ts#diff-b47d97e5d55211e2025f70dfb7e7eb7e5d41788be0e28eb52d5df652d06199f8L103).

**Expected behavior**
The method signature should not change, since [the underlying Apollo Client `ObservableQuery.fetchMore` method still has `updateQuery` in its signature](https://github.com/apollographql/apollo-client/blob/main/src/core/ObservableQuery.ts#L391).

**Environment:**
```
├── @angular/cli@14.1.3 
├── @angular/core@14.1.3 
├── @apollo/client@3.6.8 
├── apollo-angular@4.0.1 
├── barrel-maintainer@1.5.3
├── graphql@16.5.0 
└── typescript@4.7.4 
```

**Additional context**
That pretty much sums it up.

comment.body: Hi, @alfaproject — Well, so far as I can see, [`updateQuery` is still available on `ObservableQuery` in Apollo Client 3.x](https://github.com/apollographql/apollo-client/blob/643c45c4ff027a12782c7ba659ece89d19952972/src/core/ObservableQuery.ts#L402) and not marked in the code as deprecated, so I think you could continue using it with Apollo Angular 4 with suitable `@ts-ignore` comments, but since I haven't seen anything to contradict the statements from the Apollo team that I linked to in my last message indicating that `updateQuery` will be removed in Apollo Client 4 and the `fetchMore` documentation has been updated to remove reference to `updateQuery` in favor of field policies, I do think that you'll eventually have to update your code to use merge functions on field policies, one for each field that needs your dynamic `updateQuery` logic. Note that field policy merge functions can be generic with respect to the data type, just as your `updateQuery` function example is.

issue.title: `ApolloQueryResult` returning partial data in `@apollo/client@3.6.9` with `nextFetchPolicy: 'cache-only'`
issue.body:
**Intended outcome:**
The behavior of `ApolloQueryResult` and `nextFetchPolicy: 'cache-only'` changed in `@apollo/client@3.6.9`. Prior to 3.6.9, the `data` returned in the `ObservableQuery.result()` Promise resolution or Apollo Angular's `QueryRef.valueChanges` Observable would conform to the shape of the underlying query and we would not see results with `partial: true`.

**Actual outcome:**
Upon updating to `@apollo/client@3.6.9`, we now are getting `data` with missing fields and `partial: true` with no changes to our codebase.

**How to reproduce the issue:**
Compare resolution of `ApolloQueryResult` between `3.6.8` and `3.6.9` when multiple queries with different shapes but the same variables are triggered.

**Versions**
  System:
    OS: macOS 12.4
  Binaries:
    Node: 14.19.1 - ~/.nvm/versions/node/v14.19.1/bin/node
    npm: 6.14.16 - ~/.nvm/versions/node/v14.19.1/bin/npm
  npmPackages:
    @apollo/client: 3.6.9 => 3.6.9 
    apollo-angular: 3.0.1 => 3.0.1 
    apollo-server-core: 3.10.0 => 3.10.0 
    apollo-server-express: 3.10.0 => 3.10.0

comment.body:
I figured out how to create a simple Apollo-Angular StackBlitz with local schema and `ApolloLink` resolvers but have thus far been able to reproduce the issue in a shareable project.

I did discover, however, that the return of partial data starting in `@apollo/client@3.6.9` does not occur without `nextFetchPolicy: 'cache-only'`, which we have set in our project to prevent refetching queries on `cache.evict()` while still getting cache updates from other requests/explicit refetches. In addition, partial data also affects normal `ObservableQuery` (Apollo Angular `QueryRef.valueChanges` Observable `ApolloQueryResult`) emissions, not just those from `ObservableQuery.result()` which I had first noted, so I updated the issue title and description to reflect these two new findings.

The problem seems to be restricted to queries on types which have field parameters on multiple array fields similar to the simplified example below. Our application has multiple queries on the same parent document, some of which return only the non-Array properties, some only the `_id` and one array property, some only the `_id` and another array property. These queries are being sent over the network and the data returned includes the correct fields but the local ObservableQueries are sometimes emitting partial results. Perhaps we have multiple queries in flight simultaneously with requests for the same Parent but different fields and the local ObservableQueries are being fulfilled from the result of a differently shaped query on the same Parent `_id`? I'm not sure why that would happen with the default `partial: false` setting but that's as close as I've been able to narrow the problematic new behavior in 3.6.9 down to so far.

```graphql
type Parent {
  _id: ID!
  name: String!
  childList1 (someParameter: String!: [Child!]
  childList2 (someParameter: String!): [Child!]
}
```

issue.title: Apollo Angular 4.0 `QueryRef.fetchMore` parameter typings remove `updateQuery` property
issue.body:
**Describe the bug**
Upgrading from `apollo-angular@3.0.1` to `apollo-angular@4.0.1` produces TS2345 error on code which passes an `updateQuery` property to  the `fetchMoreOptions` parameter of a `QueryRef.fetchMore`call.

**To Reproduce**
Previously, the `QueryRef.fetchMore` `fetchMoreOptions` parameter was typed with `FetchMoreQueryOptions` & `FetchMoreOptions` but [Apollo Angular 4 removed `FetchMoreOptions` and with it the `updateQuery` property on the parameter](https://github.com/kamilkisiela/apollo-angular/commits/6ba15daa8ac3dc81f9077be9cc1d8ea862b0ef89/packages/apollo-angular/src/query-ref.ts#diff-b47d97e5d55211e2025f70dfb7e7eb7e5d41788be0e28eb52d5df652d06199f8L103).

comment.body: Finding that this typing issue still exists in release 4.1.0, I investigated further and found that while `updateQuery` is still supported Apollo Client 3, [it is deprecated](https://github.com/apollographql/apollo-client/pull/6464) and [will be removed in the next major version of Apollo Client](https://github.com/apollographql/apollo-client/blob/main/CHANGELOG.md#apollo-client-300), so while its removal in Apollo Angular 4 may be somewhat premature, it is inevitable. I refactored our use of `updateQuery` (merging paginated results) to use the Apollo Client recommended solution of adding [a field policy with a merge function](https://www.apollographql.com/docs/react/pagination/core-api/#merging-paginated-results).

issue.title: Incompatible typing with `graphql^16.0.0` produces `error TS2430: Interface 'SubscriptionResult<TData>' incorrectly extends interface 'ExecutionResult<ObjMap<unknown>, ObjMap<unknown>>'.`

labels.name: stage/0-issue-prerequisites
labels.description: Needs more information before we can start working on it

issue.body:
**Describe the bug**
When attempting to update an `apollo-angular` project to `graphql^16.0.0` project transpilation produces `error TS2430: Interface 'SubscriptionResult<TData>' incorrectly extends interface 'ExecutionResult<ObjMap<unknown>, ObjMap<unknown>>'.`:

```
Error: node_modules/apollo-angular/types.d.ts:30:18 - error TS2430: Interface 'SubscriptionResult<TData>' incorrectly extends interface 'ExecutionResult<ObjMap<unknown>, ObjMap<unknown>>'.
  Types of property 'data' are incompatible.
    Type 'TData' is not assignable to type 'ObjMap<unknown>'.

30 export interface SubscriptionResult<TData> extends ExecutionResult {
                    ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
```

**To Reproduce**
Run `tsc` on project depending on `apollo-angular@2.6.0` & `graphql^16.0.0` with a `tsconfig.json` observing the default` skipLibCheck: false`.

**Expected behavior**
Updating to `graphql^16.0.0` should work without error.

**Environment:**
```
├── @angular/cli@13.0.3 
├── @angular/core@13.0.2 
├── @apollo/client@3.5.3 
├── @types/graphql@14.5.0
├── apollo-angular@2.6.0 
├── graphql@16.0.1 
└── typescript@4.4.4 
```

**Additional context**
The bug description has been updated to correct the original incorrect attribution of this typing error to upgrading `@apollo/client^3.5.0` when in fact the upgrade causing the problem was from `graphql@15.7.2` to `graphql@16.0.1`.

comment.body: Yes, this incompatibility with the GraphQL 16 types was resolved with the release of Apollo Angular 3. There are new typing issues with Apollo Angular 4 and Apollo Client, per #1810 & #1818, but they are different from this issue.

issue.title: Cannot use subscriptions with the newest version of apollo-angular
issue.body:
As it is said in the title, I cannot use subscriptions with the newest version of apollo-angular. I saw a subscriptions-transport-ws is not used anymore. What to do with that?
Thanks for reply.

comment.body: I believe this is a duplicate of #1801. The solution is to use `graphql-ws` instead of `subscriptions-transport-ws`.
